definition: lit. able to support both heaven and earth/of indomitable spirit (idiom)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Li is a man of indomitable spirit that good.
sentences.chinese: 立是希望好男兒頂天立地。

sentences.english: The indomitable spirit of man also cant help tears.
sentences.chinese: 這個頂天立地的男人也不禁淚如雨下。

sentences.english: Rather than by the scourge, I also want to do an indomitable spirit of man.
sentences.chinese: 寧願遭天譴，我也要做一個頂天立地的男人。

sentences.english: And - what is more - you'll be a man my son!
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，孩子，你是個頂天立地的人。

sentences.english: He wants to use poetry to stand on his own two legs.
sentences.chinese: 他希望藉助詩歌頂天立地。

sentences.english: And - which is more - you'll be a Man my son!
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，孩子，你是個頂天立地的人。

sentences.english: A great man should live in this world with an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 大丈夫活在世上要頂天立地。

sentences.english: And - which is more - you will be a Man my son!
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，孩子，你是個頂天立地的人。

sentences.english: Let the wind of life, but also a peak of green mountains, indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 讓生命的風，還山嶺一峯青翠，頂天立地。

sentences.english: And-which is more-you'll be a Man!
sentences.chinese: 而且，更重要的是，你會成爲一個頂天立地的人。

sentences.english: Be brave and upright that God may love them.
sentences.chinese: 上帝愛護那些勇敢的頂天立地的人。

sentences.english: He is a hero of indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 他是個頂天立地的英雄。

sentences.english: But those that do survive are wondrous.
sentences.chinese: 但是那些倖存下來的就頂天立地了。

sentences.english: And - which is more - you’ll be a Man my son!
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，孩子，你是個頂天立地的人。

sentences.english: Facing south on behalf of the sky, many fortunes, good Feng Shui.
sentences.chinese: 坐北朝南代表頂天立地，財運亨通，風水好。

definition: universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
